intro: Calandrinia densa, commonly known as the dense-flowered portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to drought conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calandrinia densa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
